sub_title: Architect - Sustainable Design - Pedestrian flow Analytics at ZJA | RIBA architect(UK) | Architecten Register(NL) | Council of Architecture(India)
summary:
Anurag Bhattacharya is an architect and project coordinator at ZJA, a Dutch architecture studio founded in 1990 and based in Amsterdam. He grew up in India and graduated from the NIT Trichy, where he studied architectural engineering and design. He received his Master of Architecture from Delft University of Technology with an honorable mention. He is a registered architect in the Netherlands and India, as well as a chartered member of the RIBA UK. Anurag has given guest lectures and talks at various academic and commercial events and he is a member of Advisory Committee at Delft University of Technology.

Anurag started at ZJA in 2014 as part of the design team for the renovation of the renowned Thialf ice-skating arena in Heerenveen (NL). So far, he has contributed to 70+ projects ranging from large-size complex infrastructure including stations and bridges, as well as sports and leisure related projects. He has gained extensive experience with projects of varying scales and a wide range of project phases, from design and programming up to developing construction details. Throughout, he has had a focus on designing creatively with the site’s constraints while creating environmentally sustainable approaches.

Anurag also worked on the new Erasmusline station (HSE) in The Hague (NL), where he assisted in the development of the design and optimization of the roof geometry, which was completed in 2016. This project highlighted the value of parametric design workflows and cross-disciplinary collaborations to achieve the integration of engineering expertise, which led to file-to-factory manufacturing capabilities. He was part of the winning team for the competition of the Diamond Exchange, Capital C Amsterdam, which was completed in 2019. Anurag also played an active role in the research and design of the Shaded Dome concept, which has been awarded a European patent as a unique and novel architectural concept. This concept was further elaborated in the design and construction of Freedom Museum, Groesbeek (NL), which was completed in 2020.

In his current role, Anurag is responsible for coordinating project teams, overseeing the aesthetic and technical aspects of the design, carrying projects through from conception to realization. He has a particular interest in the implementation of emerging technologies related to design, computation, fabrication, and sustainability strategies. Partly for this reason, Anurag is actively engaged in research efforts and knowledge sharing within ZJA.

It is the platform for Dutch design and is the largest design event in the Netherlands and belongs to the top 3 when it comes to the most influential design events in the world. projects.title: Mikkeli AGRI_flux (Masters Graduation Project)
projects.description:
The city of Mikkeli sits at an interesting crossroads. At once a dwindling industrial center and a growing administrative and services city. In the 19th and 20th centuries, Mikkeli harbour was a busy industrial and tourist port. The transition of use of shipping to road reduced the industrial use of the harbour. The same railway that helped make its industry has become a block for the connection of the city with the lakefront. The challenge here is to bridge this gap in Mikkeli and strengthen the strip’s identity as a cultural center and agro_energy-hub for the city and region. 

The goal is to develop a self-sufficient eco-structure using performance driven computation techniques taking instances from biomimetic principles occurring in nature. It is done in three interlinked stages – first being the urban and infrastructure level, second being the more precise building level and the last being the ecological cycle. The architectural design emphasis being on design of the science center integrated with jetty/ public esplanades and the public green houses.

projects.title: Globalisation Studio_Complex Cities (Argentina)
projects.description: The outcome of this course can be defined as an urban planning and design challenge where teams of master students of Architecture and Urbanism will offer a diagnosis of the intervention area (Buenos Aires, Nueva Pompeya), a clear developing vision for the whole south of the City of Buenos Aires, and will end with proposing a design related intervention, illustrating the potentialities of each vision, the inclusionary aspects related to the needs and potentialities of the various stakeholders as well as considering some spatial planning instruments and strategies to be able to activate their proposal. This had being implemented by a joint studio were the TUD students have being working for three weeks with the students and mentors from University of Buenos Aires, TU Vienna, GSD Harvard and University of Houston, under the program support of the spatial planning unit of the Buenos Aires municipality and Ministry of Argentina.

projects.title: XXL Parametric Stadium Design Workshop
projects.description: The XXL workshop is concerned with the design, computation, engineering, and production of a horizontal large span building structure. This design process is done as a collaborative digital design in a multidisciplinary group of students in which each student has his/her own different responsibility. I am holding the position of the Project Architect. The collaborative digital design requires an integrated 3D approach with BIM (Building Information Modeling), performance analysis, and file to factory processes.

profile_positions.description:
ZJA Zwarts & Jansma Architects - Amsterdam | Brussels | Dubai 
ZJA is an internationally oriented office founded in 1990 and specializes in infrastructure, public transport, sport and leisure. We value our reputation as designers of stadiums, bridges, stations and motorways.

My role:
- Acquired high level of working knowledge of technical and conceptual design skill set such as public space, sports infrastructure, transportation hubs, bridges, commercial areas
- Developed detailed design and structural geometry with extensive use of Rhino + Grasshopper.
- Use of computational tools and algorithms to solve complex geometric and systemic problems.
- Working with internationally renowned architects, specialists and projects.
- Key member in the initiation and completion of several projects from concept design to early construction stages.
- Working closely with clients, consultants and project team.
- Detailed design using Building Information Modelling integration
- Experience working with Dutch, Belgian, Indian, Scandinavian and Dubai planning and building regulations.
profile_positions.title: Architect and Parametric Design Specialist

profile_positions.description: Giving advice about alumni relations strategy to TU Delft University central board and various TU Delft faculty boards.
profile_positions.title: TU Delft Alumni advisory board member

company.name: UIA World Congress of Architects CPH 2023

profile_positions.company: UIA World Congress of Architects CPH 2023
profile_positions.description:
The agenda of the UIA World Congress of Architects 2023 is ambitious. Across 6 panels, the congress asks how architecture can activate its profound agency in shaping our societies to forge a sustainable, equitable and inclusive future for all. It aims to promote, discuss, create, and showcase architecture as a vital tool to achieve the UN 17 Sustainable Development Goals. In the Science Track, congress questions, how architectural knowledge, through research and practice, can challenge the way architecture is performed, designed, and realized. 

I am a contributor to the peer review process of the UIA World Congress 2023 CPH Science Track Call for  Panel 1: Design for Climate Adaptation.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Peer Review Committee

profile_positions.description:
Topic of the webinar was “Bending the Steel”. 

During this webinar I spoke about the design process, parametric design and construction phases of the Lightrial Staion (HSE) at the Hague(NL).

The main eye-catcher of the station is the ensemble of the roofing, which consists of curved glass and bent steel that connects the metro station with the The Hague Central train station. The roof’s design was developed and optimized using parametric and computational design methods, allowing a significant reduction in the quantity of materials used in the steel structure.
profile_positions.title: Invited Speaker

profile_positions.description:
Topic of the webinar was 'Architecture shapes performance'. 

During this webinar, I shed light on the added value of parametric design and the importance of multidisciplinary collaborations for the Freedom Museum in Groesbeek and the Shaded Dome.
profile_positions.title: Invited Speaker

profile_positions.description:
Topic of webinar was Diamantbeurs Capital C, Amsterdam with following agenda topics:
- When architecture meets cutting-edge technology and conservation
- Complex glass façade geometry and optimization strategies
- Sustainability and building physics
profile_positions.title: Invited Speaker

profile_positions.description:
Lecture was a part of FabCity | EU2016NL UrbanAgenda.

Topic of lecture was "The Shaded Dome™" 

The Shaded Dome™ is a semi-permanent facility, comprised of an air-supported, environmentally controlled dome in which a pleasant microclimate is created.The dome is positioned under a tent layer (the Shade), supported by a steel cable structure. This passive design element provides the dome with protection from often demanding climatological conditions.
profile_positions.title: Invited Speaker

profile_positions.description:
Topic of lecture was "Digital Craftsmanship: thinking - scripting|modeling - building". 

Hyperbody’s lecture series is organized for MSc 1 and MSc 3 vertical studio students. The studio explores potential of robotics, interactive systems embedded in architecture employed for climate control, distributed and renewable energy production as well as spatial reconfiguration. In this context lecture series provides theoretical and application background on the influence of industrial and digital technologies on society, culture, and architecture.
profile_positions.title: Guest Speaker

profile_positions.title: Invited Speaker

profile_positions.description:
KuiperCompagnons - Rotterdam | Shanghai
For almost 100 years, KC has united spatial and urban planning and design, architecture and landscape development. KC built its reputation upon developing integrated solutions for the complex challenges within the Netherlands and applies this expertise to award-winning designs all over the world.

My role:
• Landscape, architecture  and planning key team member during visioning and initial concept and schematic design process on project site of 150 acres and development program of Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport, New Delhi (India) - Aerocity beautification.
• Project demanded of ­­­a worldclass and iconic image of progressive india which will act as a gate for 30 million passengers domestic and international passing by it every year.
• Prepared three architectural design and subdivision landscape plans through schematic design phase, further developing skills in spatial composition and scaling of larger-sized development areas (over 10 hectares). Acquired high level of working knowledge of technical and conceptual design parameters such as public spaces and commercial areas.
• Actively participated in five days of intensive schematic design charrettes and meetings with the client and sub consultants on site location in New Delhi, India.
profile_positions.title: Architect (Atelier Internationaal)

volunteer_experiences.description: Being living abroad, I have always wanted to associate myself with a NGO which works for education and upliftment of underprivileged children in India. My role is to facilitate traction required to transform passion of children and youth from marginalized communities into gainful employment opportunities through career guidance. I created presentations and scripts which were delivered to these children connected to NGO by local volunteers deployed in second and third tier cities of India. I attended feedback sessions at one to one level.
